curam.util.ctm.bom

Interface PostCommitActionBOM

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BusinessObjectModule

    public interface PostCommitActionBOM
extends BusinessObjectModule

    Business object types that do require post-commit processing will require bespoke implementations of this BusinessObjectModule(BOM).

    On doing apply action on a change set, some business objects require that further actions are carried out after all changes have been committed to the database. For example, reprocessing or recalculation activities may need to be triggered. Therefore, after the transaction is committed, the engine invokes on the 'Post Commit Actions' BOM for each business object added or deleted in the change set. It obtains the BOM for the business object type from the registry, and invokes it, supplying the business object identity and the Action (i.e. 'Add' or 'Delete').

    An out-of-the-box 'no-op' implementation will be provided for business object types that do not require any further post-commit processing. Business object types that do require post-commit processing will require bespoke implementations of this BOM. After the post-commit actions BOM has been invoked for every business object in the change set, the apply flow is completed.

    • Method Detail

      • postCommit

        void postCommit(BusinessObjectIdentifier boIdentifier,
                java.lang.String action,
                org.w3c.dom.Document boDocument)
         throws AppException,
                InformationalException
        After the transaction is committed, the engine invokes on the 'Post Commit Actions' BOM for each business object added or deleted in the change set.

        Business object types that do require post-commit processing will require bespoke implementations of this BOM. After the post-commit actions BOM has been invoked for every business object in the change set, the apply flow is completed.

        Parameters:
        boIdentifier - Contains business object identifier.
        action - Contains action (i.e. 'Add' or 'Delete').
        boDocument - Contains xml document representing the business object.
        Throws:
        AppException - Generic exception signature.
        InformationalException - Generic exception signature.
